CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01A02

TITLE.P: Design, Development, Delivery and Operation of Extra Care Housing on Sites at Gosport, New Milton and Petersfield

SHORT_DESCR.P: Hampshire County Council (HCC) wishes to contract with a business partner and /or registered housing provider to part fund, design, build and operate extra-care housing on the above 3 sites which are owned by the council. The council is currently concluding the development principles with the local planning authority for each of the 3 sites. From these we are anticipating that detailed planning permission could be obtained for circa 50 apartments per scheme with a bedroom mix of 66 % 1 bed and 34 % 2 bed. We are looking to encourage bids for a mixture of tenures including full market sale but with the majority, circa 70 % to be affordable rent.

Bids are to be invited for the above requirements as set out in the associated principles of design documents; based on a balance sheet of scheme costs and income that identifies the bidders' own financial contribution (secured against rents, sales and other funds), plus any other public sector capital “gap funding”.

Hampshire County Council (HCC) wishes to contract with a business partner to fund, build and operate an extra care (assisted living) housing scheme on a site previously known as Bulmer House in Petersfield, Hampshire. The scheme should support the construction of circa 50 flats on a mix of 66 % 1 bed and 34 % 2 bed. Bids are invited (via the open procedure) for a mixed “affordable rented /shared ownership /market sale” solution, on a balance sheet of scheme costs and income (proforma) that identifies the bidders' own financial contribution(secured against rents, sales and other funds), plus any other public sector capital “gap funding” that may be required.
This includes the opportunity:
1— to take a lease hold on the site for 250 years,
2— to design (in accordance with and the Hampshire County Council Design Guide for the delivery of extra care housing,
3— obtain planning permission,
4— build and be the landlord of an Older Persons Extra-Care Housing Scheme comprising a total of circa 50 apartments,

5— to ensure the continuity of community facilities through sufficient space within the scheme, developed in a smart way to allow for the provision of space for day services activities for non resident older persons (circa 25 service users for services commissioned by the council) during hours to be specified, which will be available at all other times for use by and for the benefit of the scheme landlord (the council's lessee), residents and /outside community groups.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: A bidder offering to deliver all 3 lots has the option of offering an alternative discounted price on each lot. If the aggregate of the 3 discounted scores proves to be the highest overall score then this will be deemed the most economically advantageous tender for Hampshire County Council.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Hampshire County Council (HCC) wishes to contract with a business partner to fund, build and operate an extra care (assisted living) housing scheme on a site previously known as Addenbrooke House in Gosport, Hampshire. The scheme has should support the construction of circa 50 flats on a mix of 66 % 1 bed and 34 % 2 bed. The scheme has should support the construction of circa 50 flats on a mix of 66 % 1 bed and 34 % 2 bed. This includes the opportunity:

If the aggregate of the three discounted scores proves to be the highest overall score then this will be deemed the most economically advantageous tender for Hampshire County Council.

SUITABILITY.P: As defined in the tender documentation.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: As defined in the tender documentation.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Selection criteria as stated in the procurement documents.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: The Stage 1 selection criteria will be based on 2 relevant experience case studies which will comprise 100 % of the scored marks.
The Stage 2 Award Criteria are as follows:

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: A pass mark of 50 % will apply at Stage 2.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Please refer to the tender documentation.

INFO_ADD.P: Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire and complete their tender document and stage 1 questionnaire, together with any supporting information by 14:00 hrs on 13.6.2018.
Clarifications regarding the ITT must be submitted by 17:00 hrs on 4.6.2018.
The ITT documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting “View Details” on the relevant tender advert and clicking the express interest tab.
Once in the tender there are 5 tabs; “Tender” “ITT documents”, “Correspondence”, “Clarifications” and “History”.
Select the second tab (ITT docs) where you will find useful information under the “Tender Details”.
Continue to scroll down to the heading “Tender Documents Received” where you will be able to view /download the documents.
Please note you are required to “Opt In” before you can access the “My Tender Return” to start populating your response.
The “Opt out” functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process.

Opting out will give you the option of declaring that you no longer want to receive any further communication inrelation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing feedback and comments for this decision.
You may amend the decision to opt in or out at any time during the tender process.

In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender — download and upload documents /returns and if required register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-Tend website under the “Help” or “Information for Suppliers Buttons”.

In addition, guidance on how to participate in the a tender — download and upload documents /returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the intend website under the “Help” or “Information For Suppliers Buttons”.
To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain ‘@in-tend.co.uk’ to your Safe Senders list.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: As set out in the public contracts Regulations Directive 2014/24/EU.
